title: ISic001189. Haluntium honours the son of Timandros
body:
Facsimile Images

1         ΟΔΑΜΟΣ      
2.ΙΩΤΟΝΤΙΜΑΝΔΡΟ[.]
3ΕΥΝΟΙΑΣΕΝΕΚΕ.

Apparatus criticus

  • Text based upon autopsy;
  • 2: Salinas: [Κ]ίωτον; Kaibel: [Β]ίωτον; lapis: trace of upper eye of Β (contra Salinas, trace of K).

Italian translation

Il damos (onora) Biotos figlio di Timandros per benevolenza

English translation

The people (honours) Biotos son of Timandros, for the sake of goodwill

commentary

Notwithstanding the damage, it is clear that there was no ethnic included in the first part of the text, and the inscription appears complete. The name Βίωτος is also attested on tile and amphora stamps from southern Italy; no other form ending -ιωτος is known from the region.

bibliography

  • 14.0366 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072
  • 43 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000531
  • Salinas NSA 1880 194 no. 4 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001392
  • Consani 1996 125 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002071
Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence.
